column8: I've noticed in several examples, e.g. 45, that prog. verbs are idiomatically translated as compl. verbs. Having in mind that these are not literal transl., the prog. translations still work, eg. 48: (They) we leaving (when they) chose one pear each (and) they went to where the full tree of pears was [if several examples are treated as a part of a greater narrative]. Examples on even pages are more indented than those on odd pages. Moreover, this stibe should be in line with the rest of the example.

Why do the glossary examples in Appendix B start again from 1, i.e. 001? It makes things difficult if some examples are referenced in the main text, e.g. example (1) and shortly after that you have (008). One may look at Ap.1. for both examples. The numbering should continue and instead 001 should be 64
